You just took her extensive success at face value, never once thinking that there might be something more to it. Perhaps the two of you could also work on your history assignment on Greek mythology, since Nicole had claimed to already be done last time you talked with her. “Sure has turned awfully stormy all of a sudden...” you said as you noted the storm clouds having rolled in within the span of a minute or so from a perfectly clear sky. How odd.

“Crap. Uh...y-yeah... I-I guess you want to head back to your place before it gets worse, right?" Nicole said with an unusual hint of nervousness in her voice, almost like she wanted you to go. However at this point her house was closer, and something told you that Nicole was hiding something and this freak storm had something to do with it.

"Nah, I'm good. Besides, we're almost to your place." you point out.

"...Oh yeah. Well, let's hurry. And by 'us', I mean 'you'. Wouldn't want to leave you eating my dust!" Nicole teased, and the two of you ran the rest of the way. Conveniently just narrowly avoiding the downpour as you and she headed inside, almost like something was making the clouds wait for one of you to get to shelter. And it probably wasn't you.

As usual, her parents weren't home. Come to think of it, you've never seen them, let alone met them. You follow Nicole downstairs into the game room, by far the largest room in the house. "I'll be right back. Gotta empty my gym bag of these clothes or else it's going to reek. You know where everything is, David, so help yourself!" she said absentmindedly.

You noted the slightly dusty case cover on the floor: the latest God of War game. You were with her when she bought it, but her game library consisted of little else. What was it about Kratos she liked so much? You turned around, only to come face-to-face with...an old man?!

"GAH!!!" you yelped out of surprise. He had a beard and wore predominantly white clothing. He was alarmingly well built, and had a commanding presence. The weirdest thing was that he was completely dry despite the downpour still going on outside.

"Hm. I thought I was her only visitor today. Must have forgotten..." the man said with a voice almost like crashing thunder. He then said, "No matter. You'd find out sooner or later, my boy."

You had no idea what he meant until Nicole walked out from the laundry room with...wings?! You always thought of her like an angel, but this?

"I'm...busted, aren't I?" Nicole said, and to your shock her wings drooped with her mood. Her wings were very much real! They were pretty though.

"Zeus, I've earned those trophies. I find it nice to receive rewards for a change instead of handing them out all the time. Not that we actually do much of anything these days. Even you resorted to putting on a show just to visit me." Nicole stated bluntly. Zeus?

"...Fine. The skies are clear now." he said, and from the sound of things outside, the clouds dispersed in a hurry.

Nicole then turned her gaze to you and said with a slightly sad tone, "David, I'm sorry I never told you sooner. As much as these wings make me seem like an angel, I'm not. My real name is Nike. I'm the goddess of victory. But I guess the trophy wall kind of speaks for itself. And yes, my powers do include knowing where someone is looking at me at a particular moment. Or whatever happens to be on their mind. I came here mostly out of boredom, but I have to say I'm delighted at most of the things named after or inspired by me. Especially the Nike company!

"But I suppose I should introduce you to the king of the gods, well of us Greek ones. David, this is Zeus. Nike sighed and put her hand to her face as you attempted to shake feeling back into your hand after.

"I've...gotta go. I'll be right back, trust me." you said and left the room for the bathroom upstairs.

But before you went fully up the stairs, you caught a part of the two gods' conversations. It still blew your mind that you were dating a goddess.

"You care for him, don't you? He might not accept you now that he knows the truth, and even if he does, you would do well to remember that he is just a mortal boy. "I trust David to see past it, especially for what I have planned for him. I know his time will come, father, but it just means I need to make it count." Nike said, and it sounded like she was standing her ground. You go up and relieve yourself, but do you go back down, or run?

"Ten?!" You gasped "If you divided ten times . . ." You did some quick math in your head "That is over 600 Nicoles!"

134.content:
Unbeknownst to either of you, the source of your girlfriend's growth was actually caused by you. A week or so ago, you were walking through a park, when you happened upon a wishing well. Reading the plaque at the base of the well, it stated that any wish thought or spoken in its presence would be granted.

Thinking it was all a big load of hogwash, you dig a quarter out of your pocket and flip it into the well. You hear the coin bounce off the brick inside the well, before hearing a splash a few seconds later.

You thought of your girlfriend Nicole and even though you loved everything about her, you had wished in the past that she was taller. (A measly 5'6" to your 5'11".)

Rolling your eyes at what you were about to do, you whisper so no one else around could hear, "I wish I could alter anything physically about my girlfriend, Nicole." The inside of the well seemed to glow green momentarily. Wanting to investigate further, but knowing you were almost late for school, you instead made your way to your car and drove off.

Of course, that was 8 days ago. The wishing well incident was far from your mind. So you were surprised when you met up with your girlfriend the next day and found she was half an inch taller. The day after that, she was a full inch taller. You were loving her new height and wished it would continue, not realizing that by "wishing" for it in your mind or saying it out loud was causing Nicole to grow further.

Twenty minutes later, Nicole emerged from the showers, walking towards you.

"Ready to go, sweetie?" she asked, taking hold of your hand as you walked toward your car.

"Where do you want to go?" you ask her.

15.content:
David was with his girlfriend, Savannah, in her backyard. The 16 year old's backyard was HUGE, and a tad unkempt during the summer when it was just too darn hot to cut the grass. David jokingly referred it as going into Savannah's savanna, to which the blonde haired, blue eyed girl took a liking to and started referring to it as that herself. She often told David how she wanted to go to the African savannah...and the Australian outback...and the North Pole...and outer space... the list went on. She loved adventure, some would say THRIVED on it, and knew the forest beyond her backyard easily like the back of her own pale hand. David never understood why she was so pale when the only time she was indoors was when she absolutely had to be. She hated being indoors, and was always dressed in the clothes of an adventurer. David felt her outfit made her look like a female version of Indiana Jones, to which her response was to kiss him at the time.

Today would be the start of a new adventure for Savannah. One of giant proportions - literally.

"You want to go out to a restaurant, Savannah? We could explore this new place that opened up... I think it's called, Titan's Bounty?" David suggested.

Savannah thought about it for a second. She was feeling slightly hungry, but more for adventure than for food. She looked at David lying there like a lump. A lump that she nonetheless found herself attracted to. "Or, we could dig in the forest for possible buried treasure. You never know." She proposed.

Speaking of treasure, David remembered this mysterious potion for lack of a better term that he found in some dusty old shop, with the description cryptically stating, 'drink, and become the hearts' desire' He assumed the apostrophe being after the 's' to be a spelling mistake but curiosity won over and he had bought it anyway. He was going to challenge Savannah into drinking this, believing it to be just a hoax and nothing more but knowing she couldn't resist a challenge, when another idea popped into his head. Savannah had told him the other day about this gun she found abandoned by her driveway. He had his suspicions as to what it was, and dreamed of her using it on herself.

"Hm, it could be fun...but what about that toy gun thing you found the other day? I dare ya to try it on yourself!" David announced, then quickly added, "Or...you try out this odd potion thing I've got here, said to make the drinker the 'hearts' desire'. It's misspelled, so it's gotta be worth a hoot, right?"

Savannah narrowed her eyes and smiled. Oh how she loved challenges, but she wanted to be sure the proverbial gauntlet had been thrown. "Is that a challenge, David? Shoot a toy gun at myself, or drink your joke drink. Is that right?"
